skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: This complex distillation not only preserves the drinker in glorious Unlife, it also increases their physical resistance to attack.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Bleak as a panorama of necropoli. Painful as a Khepra beetle down your throat. Such is the sorcery of these disciples.

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Nehekhara spells

skillTree.localised_description: When intoned, this ritual text holds back decay so the Tomb Kings' souls can be bound to their mortal remains once more.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(own armies factionwide)

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are specialised rituals, chants and incantations for drawing forth dead spirits and binding them back into their corporeal forms; this one knows them all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing your way around the Realm of Souls, along with knowledge of the required ritual incantations, are essential skills for the dedicated Liche Priest.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -5%
	(enemy characters in region)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a larger unit of Skeleton Warriors
Activates automatically when conditions are met
Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions

skillTree.localised_description: It is an honor indeed to be joined in battle by one of such distinction.
Far from a symbol of vanity, the priest's headdress can strengthen their connection to the winds.
Not only a token of his office, the staff's runic inscriptions empower and protect the priest.
Though typically performed in the necropolis, lesser incantations can be performed on the battlefield.
Sometimes it's possible to bend time.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Only few casters are able to stabilize winds of magic.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: To fall to a Lich Priest's curse is to suffer and serve his whims for eternity.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Screaming Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units
	(Hero's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Casket of Souls units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.

skillTree.localised_description: By which the dead don't stay that way for long, springing back into jerking, clanking Unlife.
Sword-blows are mysteriously turned away as Ptra's wife reaches out to shield Nehekhara's warriors from evil.

skillTree.localised_description: When the verses are spoken, a fierce light emanates from the Undead's empty eye-sockets, enabling them to strike with supernatural speed and fury.

skillTree.localised_description: As the names of Usirian are invoked, skeletal hands burst forth from beneath the sand to drag the foe to their graves.

skillTree.localised_description: Every syllable strips moisture and saps vitality from the bodies of Usekhp's unfortunate victims.

skillTree.localised_description: A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -5
	(enemy armies in region)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.
Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

skillTree.localised_description: With the right amount of preparation, everything can harnessed to empower even the soldiers mundane weapons.

skillTree.localised_description: We will establish triage and treatment centers as soon as we make camp, my lord.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +4%
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 6

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

Wound action: Additional 30% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.

This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
